comments.comment:
Looks like that on org.apache.maven.surefire.testng.TestNGReporter.onTestFailure( ITestResult result ) the ITestResult can also not have an attached throwable.
Debugging the previous failure I find out the the problem was in a setup method and TestNG is not providing any useful information for the error except for the method name.

Avoiding the previous NPE is simple enough, though...We should add a check in PojoStackTraceWriter.writeTraceToString()

Patch committed.
Closing without setting version, 2.4.1 is already a candidate so it will probably not be included (to be verified)

For historical record, patch submitted revision 615569.

http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/maven/surefire/trunk/surefire-api/src/main/java/org/apache/maven/surefire/report/PojoStackTraceWriter.java?r1=597825&r2=615569&diff_format=h

What exactly was the problem in the setup method? I tried to reproduce this with 2.4 but was unable to do so.

Specifically, what version of TestNG were you using? I checked the source for TestNG 5.5 5.6 and 5.7; Invoker.java line 191 is not handleConfigurationFailure in any of those versions...?

For the record, the ITestResult from onTestFailure is ALWAYS supposed to have a throwable, even if it's just a TestNGException. This isn't a case where nulls are allowed but we forgot to anticipate them... TestNG is not supposed to present us a null value.

Without a stacktrace, the user has no way of knowing what to do about the failure.
2.4.2 isn't planned, so we might as well take a second now to include this in 2.4.1.
